citations.narrative:
The facility representative stated that they lost one baby emu in their outdoor facility due to predation because of a hole in
their perimeter fence. If facilities are not maintained in good repair, it can result in injury and death of the animal. Housing
facilities must be kept in good repair, protect the bird, and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect
the welfare of the birds within.
CORRECTED PRIOR TO INSPECTION ON 25 JUNE 2024

Facility personnel stated that they have not reviewed the contingency plan since 2022. Annual reviews to the contingency
plan ensure that changes to the facility program are accounted for in emergency planning. The facility must ensure that
they maintain documentation of their annual review and any updates to their contingency plan.
CORRECT BY: 23 JULY 2024

The outdoor housing facility for the hyena was severely rusted. This could affect the structural integrity of the enclosure
and cause harm to the animal. The facility must ensure the outdoor housing facility is structurally sound and maintained in
good repair to protect the animal from injury.
CORRECT BY 16 JULY 2024

At the time of inspection, there were screws hanging out of perches and on walls of the primary enclosure for the 2 yellow
amazons and the scarlet macaw. The sharp points could cause injury to the birds. There were also sharp edges along the
wall of the enclosures. The facility must ensure that all primary enclosures are constructed and maintained so they have
no sharp points or edges that could cause injury to the birds.

The door to the primary enclosure for the blue and gold macaw had deterioration at the bottom panel of the door and a
hole in the wall to the left of the door due to rusting. The enclosure for the 2 yellow amazons had a hole in the roof. This
leaves openings where the animals could attempt to escape from the enclosure or potentially get stuck and cause injury.
Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair and maintained so that it will contain the animals securely. The facility
must repair the holes in the enclosure for the health and safety of the animals.
CORRECT BY: 16 JULY 2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
During inspection, none of the bird enclosures had enrichment. The enclosures were large enough for the birds to do
some flying, however, besides perching there was nothing in the enclosures. Failure to meet those needs can result in
stress, obesity, or the development of abnormal/harmful behaviors. The licensee must follow their enrichment that was
developed and approved by their attending veterinarian.
CORRECT BY: 16 JULY 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director n
